3: Lucia... That's enough. If it was going to work, it would've worked already... We've lost contact with Liv.
...Let's turn around to find her immediately.
(Peeks from your hiding place) The moment we entered this group of buildings, we had already alerted all the guards.
If we turn around now, we'll be facing an uphill battle.
I'll go look for Liv. You stay here to protect Commandant.
I originally thought that Liv and Browning had successfully activated the distractor, and they had shut off their comms for technical reasons...
But seeing the number of guards here, I'm pretty sure there's no distraction device to begin with.
(Holds up the device in his hand) This is the distractor we found on the enemy's body earlier, but it was busted long ago.
Even if we can contact Liv, there's no way we can lure the guards away for her with this.
You were right about Browning. Something's wrong with him.
I only made my hypothesis based on the facts we had.
I had my suspicion when Browning recommended splitting us up.
Doesn't matter if Liv's in danger or not. The fact that she's with Browning right now is my responsibility.
And now I must find her.
(Looks at you) You have to stay with Commandant. My frame is not powerful enough to guarantee the commandant's safety.
I see... Our frames are different, aren't they? I'll leave Liv to you.
